meanings.definition: To establish a colony in (a place) again.
meanings.sent1: The explorers wanted to recolonize the island after it had been abandoned for many years.
meanings.sent2: The settlers decided to recolonize the area and build a new community.
meanings.sent3: The idea to recolonize the deserted land seemed like a challenging adventure.
meanings.sent4: The group's plan to recolonize the region was met with both excitement and skepticism.
meanings.sent5: Their mission was to recolonize the uninhabited territory and create a thriving society.

meanings.definition: To settle in (a place) again with a new group of people.
meanings.sent1: The nomadic tribe aimed to recolonize the valley and make it their new home.
meanings.sent2: After the war, many families decided to recolonize the town and start afresh.
meanings.sent3: The decision to recolonize the remote village brought hope to the displaced families.
meanings.sent4: The refugees worked together to recolonize the barren land and rebuild their lives.
meanings.sent5: Their goal was to recolonize the fertile plains and establish a thriving community.
